gw.pl.messaging

Class MessageStatus

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.pl.messaging.MessageStatus

  • public class MessageStatus
extends java.lang.Object
    c 2003 Guidewire Software Creator information: User: jseybold Date: Sep 19, 2003

    Revision information:

    Set of message states. Note that we rely on the actual values here, particularly that the sets of blocking and inactive states are contiguous so that we can use BETWEEN clauses for loading and purging messages. We leave some space in the number sequence in case new states need to be added in the future while preserving contiguity. We also make PENDING_SEND state contiguous with the start of the BLOCKING_STATES range so that in the future we can use a single query instead of two queries in the InitialMessageReader if necessary for performance.

        public static final int PENDING_SEND
        Messages are initially created in this state; stays until sent to the destination.

      • PENDING_ACK

        public static final int PENDING_ACK
        Messages set to this state once the MessageTransport.send() method completes but the transport does not ack the message; stays in it until acked or error received or retried.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ERROR

        public static final int ERROR
        Message has been acknowledged with an error condition. Messages in this state may NOT be retried.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ERROR_RETRIED

        public static final int ERROR_RETRIED
        Set when an message in RETRYABLE_ERROR state is retried. The original message is put into this state, and a new message is cloned and sent.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        Constant Field Values

      • BLOCKING_STATES

        public static final java.lang.Integer[] BLOCKING_STATES
        Subset of active states for messages blocking sends of subsequent messages. Only one message per claim and destination may be in any one of these states at one time. This is enforced by the DB consistency checker; do not modify this list without updating the check.

        Note that the blocking states MUST have contiguous values so that the reader can use a BETWEEN clause. This is tested by the static initializer, below. See the fields BLOCKING_STATE_MIN and BLOCKING_STATE_MAX.

      • BLOCKING_STATE_MIN

        public static final int BLOCKING_STATE_MIN
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BLOCKING_STATE_MAX

        public static final int BLOCKING_STATE_MAX
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INACTIVE_STATES

        public static final java.lang.Integer[] INACTIVE_STATES
        Set of "final" message states for messages no longer requiring any processing. Messages in these states may be removed from the database by MessageCleaner.

        Note that the inactive states MUST have contiguous values so that the cleaner can use a BETWEEN clause. This is tested by the static initializer, below. See the fields INACTIVE_STATE_MIN and INACTIVE_STATE_MAX.

      • INACTIVE_STATE_MIN

        public static final int INACTIVE_STATE_MIN
        See Also:
